list_definition.definition: a place where meals are sold in a factory, barracks etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We usually eat in the staff canteen.

list_definition.definition: a case for, or of, cutlery
a small container used by soldiers for holding water

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He refilled his canteen from the tap/faucet.

list_ex_of_english: The announcement that more food will be available for canteens will in itself assist in bringing more canteens into being.
I am told that 10,000 million meals are now served in canteens, hotels and restaurants each year.
Every effort is being made to expedite the establishment of colliery canteens where the miners desire them.
I have received no complaints that the allocation of meat to school canteens and school-feeding centres is inadequate.
I have made some investigations among miners, women and shipyard workers who are employed in areas where there are no canteens.
Furthermore, there are 100,000 small factories which have no canteens.
Where canteens are provided, it is fair to expect that they should be used.
In addition to the usual rations, food is provided in works' canteens to meet the special needs of heavy workers.
